Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored 30 points and made all eight of his 3-point attempts.
Golden State Warriors beat the Philadelphia 76ers 139-105.
Golden State led 35-19 after the first quarter and extended a 16-point halftime lead to 25 at the end of the third quarter.
Curry had 24 points by the end of the third quarter after going 6 of 6 from 3-point range.
Jonathan Kuminga added 20 points off the bench.
Joel Embiid led the Sixers with 28 points and 14 rebounds.
Curry played through a right thumb sprain with tape on his right hand, and Embiid played through a left foot sprain.
Philadelphia had their 'Big Three' of Embiid, Tyrese Maxey and Paul George on the court.
The 76ers gave up a season high in points.
Golden State got a needed wire-to-wire win against a 76ers team with all three of its stars healthy.
Curry had 13 points in the third, including back-to-back deep 3s, the second of which he banked in to put the Warriors ahead 89-68 with 4:49 left in the third quarter.
The Warriors shot 56% (22 of 39) from 3-point range and 61% from the field overall.
